tables.table_schema:
CREATE TABLE BackupSchedule (
    backup_id INT PRIMARY KEY,
    schedule_time TIMESTAMP,
    retention_policy TEXT
)

CREATE TABLE backup_schedules (
    id INT PRIMARY KEY,
    schedule_name TEXT,
    backup_frequency TEXT,
    start_time TIMESTAMP,
    next_backup TIMESTAMP
);

CREATE TABLE backups (
    id INT PRIMARY KEY,
    backup_name TEXT,
    backup_timestamp TIMESTAMP,
    size_in_bytes INT,
    schedule_id INT,
    FOREIGN KEY (schedule_id) REFERENCES backup_schedules(id)
);

CREATE TABLE backup_logs (
    id INT PRIMARY KEY,
    backup_id INT,
    log_message TEXT,
    log_timestamp TIMESTAMP,
    FOREIGN KEY (backup_id) REFERENCES backups(id)
);

CREATE TABLE backup_schedules (
    id INT PRIMARY KEY,
    backup_name VARCHAR(255),
    backup_time TIMESTAMP,
    frequency VARCHAR(50),
    retention_policy VARCHAR(50)
);

CREATE TABLE backup_logs (
    id INT PRIMARY KEY,
    backup_id INT,
    backup_status VARCHAR(20),
    backup_timestamp TIMESTAMP,
    FOREIGN KEY (backup_id) REFERENCES backup_schedules(id)
);

CREATE TABLE backup_errors (
    id INT PRIMARY KEY,
    backup_id INT,
    error_code VARCHAR(10),
    error_description TEXT,
    FOREIGN KEY (backup_id) REFERENCES backup_schedules(id)
);

CREATE TABLE recovery_points (
    id INT PRIMARY KEY,
    backup_id INT,
    recovery_time TIMESTAMP,
    recovery_status VARCHAR(20),
    FOREIGN KEY (backup_id) REFERENCES backup_schedules(id)
);
